document.docTitle: Dixella atitla Huerta & Ibanez-Bernal 2021, sp. nov.
document.masterDocTitle: A new species of Dixella, the first Mexican record of Dixella shannoni, and a summary of dixid records from Mexico (Diptera: Dixidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new species of Dixella, the first Mexican record of Dixella shannoni, and a summary of dixid records from Mexico (Diptera: Dixidae)

mods:name.mods:affiliation: Laboratorio de Entomología, Instituto de Diagnóstico y Referencia Epidemiológicos (InDRE), Francisco P. Miranda # 177, Unidad Lomas de Plateros, DT. Álvaro Obregón, 01480, Ciudad de México, México.
Instituto de Ecología, A. C., Red Ambiente y Sustentabilidad, Antigua Carretera a Coatepec No. 351, El Haya, Xalapa, 91073, Veracruz, México.

heading.emphasis:
Dixella atitla Huerta & Ibáñez-Bernal
, sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type specimens .
HOLOTYPE Male. MEXICO , Veracruz , Huatusco , Laguna de Santo Domingo , 22, February , 1992; leg. Ibáñez-Bernal, S. (mounted on microscope slide, in CAIM )
.
Paratypes : Same data as holotype
,
1 ♂ ( IEXA )
,
1 ♀ ( CAIM )
,
1 ♀ ( IEXA )
.

Diagnosis.
Dixella atitla
sp. nov.
is unique among species of the Neotropical region with apical lobe of the gonocoxite hammer-like ( Figs. 5A, C–D ) and gonostylus wider at base and dorsoventrally flattened, ending hookshaped, and at middle with a pair of short internal processes posteriorly directed ( Figs. 6A–E ).

Description. Male . Head ( Fig. 1A ) slightly wider than high in frontal view, dark brown; clypeus longer than width, pale yellow, with about 9 setae at disk. Antenna with scape, pedicel and flagellomeres dark brown, length 2.1 mm ; all flagellomeres cylindrical, the first flagellomere length/ wide= 12.1, two times longer than second flagellomere; palpus brown, length 0.40 mm ; palpomere ratios: 1.0: 3.0: 3.0: 3.5.

Thorax ( Figs. 2A, B ). Scutum with wide dark brown medial vitta extending from anterior margin to middle of scutum, anteriorly narrowly continuing laterally to supra-alar area and lateral dark brown vitta. Scutellum (with six setae) and mediotergite dark brown. Pleura with pronotum, propleuron, anepisternum, katepisternum, anepimeron, and metanepisternum dark brown, except the distal part of anepimeron which is yellowish. Katepisternum bare.

Wing ( Fig. 3A ). Length, 2.8 mm , width, 1.0 mm; membrane pale without dark spot over r-m; veins brown, setose except r-m and m-m; Sc elongate, extending more than 0.33 the length of the wing, ending in C, slightly before at level of the origin of the Rs; R 2+3 , arched, originating distal to r-m; stem of R 2+3 0.25 length of R 3 . Halter brown, 0.34 the length of fore femur.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 1.
Dixella atitla
sp. nov.
A–B. Head, dorsal view. C. Antenna, lateral view. A. Male; B–C. Female. Abbreviations: flgm I to V= first to fifth flagellomere; pe= pedicel; scp= scape. Scale = 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 2.
Dixella atitla
sp. nov.
A–B. Thorax, male. A. Dorsal view (pinned specimen); B. Lateral view (mounted in slide). C. Hind tibia, distal portion. D. Fifth tarsomere and claw of foreleg (dark arrow points to the seta). Scale: A–B= 0.5 mm; C–D= 0.1 mm.

FIGURE 3. Wing, dorsal view. A. Male,
Dixella atitla
sp. nov .
B. Female,
Dixella atitla
sp. nov .
C. Male,
Dixella shannoni
. Abbreviations: C= costal vein; CuA= anterior branch of cubital vein; CuP= posterior branch of cubital vein; M 1 = first branch of media; M 2 = second branch of media; M 3 + 4 = third and fourth branch of media;; m-cu= medial-cubital crossvein; m-m= medial crossvein; Rs= radial sector; R 1 = anterior branch of radius; R 2 = upper branch of second branch of radius; R 3 = lower branch of second branch of radius; R 2+3 = second branch of radius; R = third branch of radius; r-m= radial-medial crossvein; Sc = sub4+5 costal vein. Scale = 0.5 mm.

FIGURE 4.
Dixella atitla
sp. nov.
A–B. Male genitalia. C. Female genitalia. A. Tergite 9, dorsal view; B. Sternite 9, ventral view. C. Ventral view. Scale = 0.1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph: Distribution. This species is known only from the type locality Laguna de Santo Domingo, Huatusco, Veracruz , Mexico ( Fig. 7 ).
Etymology. The specific epithet is derived from Nahualt language, abbreviation of the word “ atitlaj ”, meaning “in water”, referring to the collection location.

Remarks. This new species is distinguished from all other known species of
Dixella
by the hammer-like apical lobe of the gonocoxite and flattened basally expanded gonostylus bearing a pair of apical processes. This species is most closely related to
Dixella cumbrica Peters & Cook
from Baja California Sur (Sierra Laguna), sharing similar characteristics of body color, the shape of the apical lobe of the gonocoxite and flattened gonostylus.
Dixella atitla
sp. nov.
differs from
D. cumbrica
(characters in parenthesis) in having: (1) fore coxa dark brown basally (hyaline); (2) femora yellowish with brown apices and tibiae pale brown, with brown apices (femora and tibiae light brown); (3) halter brown (hyaline); (4) wing not spotted (wing slightly spotted on r-m and base R 2+3 ); (5) scutellum with six setae (two weak setae); (6) apical lobe of the gonocoxite hammer-like (moderately long, thick, with stellate tip), and (7) gonostylus flattened, wider basally with a pair of processes (flat, simple).

The female is similar to male, with segment 10 longer than wide, V-shaped and shorter than cercus, which distinguishes it from other species for which females are known. The female of
D. cumbrica
is unknown.
